column2: MONTANA DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Montana
column6: MT

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging
column6: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way
column10: Always come to a complete stop

column2: 2. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: The light will soon change from green to red.
column6: Drive with caution.
column8: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 3. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.
column6: Leave the road immediately.
column8: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column10: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 4. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column4: school crossings.
column6: dangerous intersections.

column2: 5. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column8: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column10: turn left into the one-way road.

column2: 6. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column6: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column8: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.

column2: 7. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Pull the steering wheel back.
column6: Turn on your cruise control.
column8: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.
column10: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 8. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 9. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column4: The driver on the left.
column6: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 10. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.
column6: Long-distance commuters.

column2: 11. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column4: steer right
column6: None of the other answers is correct.
column10: stay in the center of your lane

column2: 12. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.
column6: go through as soon as the first train passes.
column8: go through when one of the tracks is free.
column10: proceed with caution until you see a train.

column2: 13. This sign means:
column4: The road ends ahead
column6: No Passing Zone

column2: 14. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column10: stop doing what they are doing.

column2: 15. Increasing your vehicle’s speed _____ your field of vision.
column4: increases
column6: decreases

column2: 16. You may not pass another vehicle on either side of a _______ centerline.
column4: single broken yellow
column6: single broken white

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down or stop
column6: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles
column8: You must make a complete stop

column2: 18. When the road is slippery, you should:
column4: use your emergency or parking brake.
column6: brake suddenly carefully.
column8: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.

column2: 19. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column6: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 20. The effect that alcohol has on your judgment:
column4: depends on the amount of alcohol in your blood.
column6: is less if you were only drinking beer.
column8: is greater if you were drinking hard liquor.
column10: is less if you were only drinking wine.

column2: 21. Night driving can be more difficult because:
column4: vehicle operators tend to drive faster at night.
column6: speed limits do not apply at night.
column10: the ratio of motorcyles to cars is much higher at night.

column2: 22. When a school bus is stopped with its red lights flashing:
column4: drivers may not pass while the red lights are flashing.
column6: drivers don't need to stop unless they are in a school zone.
column10: drivers only need to stop if children are present.

column2: 23. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.
column6: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 24. The best way to deal with tailgaters is to:
column4: pump your brakes to get them to back off.
column6: speed up to increase the space between you and the tailgater.
column8: slow down to encourage the tailgater to pass.

column2: 25. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
column4: Round
column6: Rectangle

column2: 26. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column6: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column10: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.

column2: 27. This road sign means:
column4: Side Road
column6: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 28. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.
column6: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.
column8: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.
column10: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.

column2: 29. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column4: slow down or move over safely.
column6: avoid making eye contact.

column2: 30. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column4: can handle
column6: must interrupt

column2: 31. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column4: Railroad advance warning signs (round)
column6: Warning signs (diamond)

column2: 32. This white sign means you:
column4: may turn left only on a green arrow.
column6: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.
column8: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.

column2: 33. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.
column6: decrease the following distance.

column2: 31. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column4: Railroad advance warning signs (round)
column6: Warning signs (diamond)

column2: 32. This white sign means you:
column4: may turn left only on a green arrow.
column6: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.
column8: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.

column2: 33. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.
column6: decrease the following distance.
